TopicTitle: Problem with new version of Module Manager

Articles.Content:
I am not to sure where to report this problem so I have placed it here. IF a moderator moves it to where it needs to go, then that will be absolutely great.

A few days ago, I was checking CKAN and discovered that Module Manager had an update, so being the good obedient minion to CKAN, I updated Module Manager. I had some difficulties in doing this so had to do it manually. I replaced ModuleManager 2.6.5 with the newest version, 2.6.8. I do run a mod that monitors FPS and RAM utilization (as you can see from the enclosed screen capture

).

After installing the new Module Manager, my FPS, which is normally between 32.5 and 38.5, dropped to an astounding 9 to 16.5 FPS. Nothing was added nor removed with the exception of the updating of Module Manager. Normally when I play games, I prefer them not to resemble a PowerPoint presentation.

I have since removed ModuleManager 2.6.8 and reinstalled the previous edition and the problem of the slow FPS immediately cleared up. Does anyone have any suggestions?

I look forward to all your suggestions...

remove from your gamedata forlder files:

ModuleManager.ConfigCache

ModuleManager.ConfigSHA

ModuleManager.Physiscs

ModuleManager.Tech Tree

my game won't load(eventually will, after 6 hours)unless i remove them.
